result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADJOURNED OF THE RECORD. 
Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference.
Defendant in custody. 
Court advised by attorneyTheodore O"Reilly , Attorney jaspen in trial in a different court.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. 
Scheduling Conference scheduled November 14, 2022 at 8:30am.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Michael Jerard Smith. Both parties appear via zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Deputy James Carey, MCSO. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith appeared by video, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Michael Jerard Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is not present. Squad car was involved in an accident as the deputy was attempting to appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No reply from the surety or defendant.
Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Surety failing to appear.  Court orders bail to remain forfeited.   mn

Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. MSDF fail to produce defendant for court. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Case set for a preliminary. State witness fail to appear due to no longer employeed at the Sheriff's Departement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-27-2022

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith in court by zoom with attorney Sylvan Jaspen .
William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Counsel explains client missed court due to car trouble.  The defendant also has a Justice Point Violation for a failure to report on June 9.

Court vacates the warrant and orders the $2,000 cash bail reinstated. Bail conditions remain as stated on the record.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cancellation of warrant signed and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($2,000.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith not in court.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS
06/08/2022

Court ordered no contact with KMW (DOB: 4/14/2004)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Michael Jerard Smith in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Michael Jerard Smith in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Jerard Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
